title: Pasta Salad With Tuna, Chickpeas & Lemon-mint Dressing
summary: Pasta Salad With Tuna, Chickpeas & Lemon-mint Dressing is a dairy free and pescatarian main course. One portion of this dish contains around 29g of protein, 20g of fat, and a total of 615 calories. For $1.17 per serving, this recipe covers 27% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. If you have lemon juice, vegetable broth, flat-leaf parsley, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the peas you could follow this main course with the Easy Peasy Strawberry Dessert as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour and 17 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 86%. This score is outstanding. Try Orzo Salad with Artichokes, Tomatoes, Chickpeas, Feta & Lemon Basil Dressing, Lemon Pasta Salad with Roasted Tomatoes, Chickpeas & Feta, and Grilled Tunan over Lemon-Mint Barley Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
